unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Assembly Line Probability
question_text:
Workers at a large company inspect large wooden bookcases for defects and then wrap the bookcases to be ready to ship.
The average worker takes $21\text{ seconds}$ to inspect a bookcase with a standard deviation of $3\text{ seconds}$. The average worker takes $41\text{ seconds}$ to wrap a bookcase with a standard deviation of $18\text{ seconds}$. The assembly line starts to get backed up if the entire process takes longer than $1\text{ minute}$ and $15\text{ seconds}$.
Assuming the times for each process are independent and approximately normal, what is the probability of a bookcase taking more than $1\text{ minute}$ and $15\text{ seconds}$ for the entire inspection and wrapping process?
solution:
To find the mean for the total process, we can add the means: 21+41=62 seconds.

Standard deviations cannot be added, but variances can in order to then find the standard deviation:

Variance of the entire process:

32+182=333

Remember that variance is calculated by squaring standard deviation.

The standard deviation of the entire process, therefore, is
